name: Gustav Holst Way (Guiting Power to Wyck Rissington)

ai.summary: The Gustav Holst Way from Guiting Power to Wyck Rissington is a strenuous long-distance hike in the UK, about 34.3 km in length. The route traverses rural farmland, hedged lanes, and mixed terrain with several ascents and descents, offering a challenging day or multi-day trek for experienced hikers and rewarding countryside scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain is varied: rolling countryside with a mix of grassy field paths, hedged lanes, and stony tracks, plus occasional road sections. Expect uneven ground, mud after rain, stile crossings, and exposure to open countryside in places. Elevation changes add to the challenge.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day of walking (approximately 34.3 km) and be prepared for variable UK weather. Carry a map and compass or a reliable GPS, and know how to use them. Stay on waymarked paths, watch for mud, livestock, and road crossings, and be prepared for exposed sections. Bring sufficient water and food, appropriate layers, a first aid kit, and emergency contact details. Let someone know your route and expected finish time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Weather-appropriate clothing with multiple layers (base layer, insulating layer, waterproof shell)
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 liters depending on heat)
High-energy snacks and a meal if needed
Map, compass, and/or GPS device (fully charged)
Headlamp or flashlight with spare batteries
Walking poles (optional but helpful on long ascents)
Phone with offline maps and a portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are generally best for mild weather and daylight; summer allows longer days but weather can be variable, and winter hikes are more challenging due to shorter days and harsher conditions.

seo.title: Gustav Holst Way (Guiting Power to Wyck Rissington) – 34.3 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Gustav Holst Way from Guiting Power to Wyck Rissington. A challenging 34.3 km long-distance hike in rural England with varied terrain, safety tips, and gear lists for hikers.
